title: Extended Interview: UFC Featherweight Alex Volkanovski Shuts Down Retirement Rumours | 10 News
description: Alex Volkanovski has shot down rumours surrounding his retirement from UFC.  The current Featherweight champion will face Diego Lopes in a rematch at UFC 325 in Sydney and expects to defend his title.  Watch the full chat with 10 Sport’s Brooke East here. title: Two Young Boys Arrested Near Site Of Bushfire In Sydney | 10 News
description: The bushfire fight across New South Wales continues tonight, with crews kept busy bringing dozens of blazes under control across the state. This afternoon, a quick moving bushfire in north-west Sydney sparked evacuations as it threatened multiple homes, and police have revealed two young boys were arrested not far from the fireground. title: Australia’s World-first Social Media Ban For Kids Begins Tonight | 10 News
description: The countdown is well and truly on for under 16s across the country who will be blocked from creating or accessing multiple major social media platforms.  The Federal Government is adamant, it will protect Australian youngsters from exposure to the dangers lurking online and reduce the risks associated with screen time. title: Albanian Drug Lord Escapes From Prison For The Fourth Time | 10 News
description: He’s been dubbed the “escape wizard”, and now an infamous Albanian drug lord is on the run again, breaking out of prison for the fourth time.   Toma Taulant has been convicted of drug crimes, arms trafficking, assault and robberies, and was supposed to be locked up until 2048. title: Australia Post Delivery Driver Seen Throwing Fragile Package | 10 News+
description: An Australia Post delivery driver was caught on camera throwing a package that was marked ‘fragile’, sending it flying through the air. Australia Post told 10 News+ the postie’s actions “did not align with the standard we expect” and that the matter will be managed through their “internal disciplinary process”. However, it doesn’t seem like an isolated issue. A Facebook page dedicated to Australia Post complaints has garnered over 30,000 followers. title: Stage Crasher Pyjama Man Kicked Out Of Gaga Concert In Brisbane | 10 News
description: The man who tackled Ariana Grande at a "Wicked: For Good" event in Singapore was filmed being kicked out of a Lady Gaga concert in Brisbane yesterday evening.  Concertgoers attending the Mayhem Ball tour at Suncorp Stadium said online that Johnson Wen, known as 'Pyjama Man', was wearing a disguise but was quickly apprehended by security.  Gaga fans broke out into cheers when Wen was escorted out within two minutes of entering the venue.  The 25-year-old stage crasher has accosted a number of celebrities this year, including Katy Perry, The Weeknd and The Chainsmokers. title: Donald Trump Gives His Own Economy Sky-High Grading | 10 News
description: US President Donald Trump has given himself a lofty grade for his economic efforts, despite an increasing number of Americans believing otherwise.  President Trump was interviewed by US outlet Politico, where the question of how he may grade his own economy was posed. "A-plus, plus, plus, plus, plus," Trump emphatically replied.  However, numbers released on Monday by a Harvard CAPS/Harris poll suggest that 57% of voters believe Trump is losing the fight against inflation, 56% think Trump's tariffs are harming the economy, and 57% believe the economy is shrinking under the second Trump administration. title: Aftershock Warnings After Japan's 7.5 Magnitude Earthquake | 10 News
description: Communities in northern Japan are assessing the damage after a 7.5-magnitude earthquake injured at least 33 people and triggered a tsunami on Monday.  The Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA) has reported the quake's magnitude as 7.5, slightly down from its earlier estimate of 7.6.  A magnitude 6.6 and later a 5.1 quake were reported by the U.S. Geological Survey in the hours after the initial earthquake. Smaller aftershocks were continuing Tuesday.  The JMA has urged residents in 182 municipalities to have a plan in place should another, larger earthquake occur in the following week. title: Several Firefighters Injured After Fire Erupts At Manhattan Apartment Building In NYC | 10 News
description: Six people including several firefighters have been injured after a massive fire erupted in an apartment building in New York.  Residents were forced to evacuate a building on Manhattan’s Upper West Side just before 8:30am on Tuesday, before the roof of the six-story building partially collapsed.  Local media reported that three residents and three firefighters were taken to hospital to be treated for minor injuries.  The cause of the fire is under investigation. title: Kentucky State University Shooting Leaves 1 Dead, 1 Injured And A Suspect In Custody | 10 News
description: One person is dead and another injured after a shooting near a residency hall at Kentucky State University (KSU).  Local authorities have reported that a suspect is in custody and the shooting is an isolated incident, not a mass shooting.   The New York Times, citing a university spokesperson, reported that the suspect was not a student, but both victims were.   KSU is a historically Black university and has more than 2,200 students and 450 faculty and staff members. title: Bodycam Footage Reveals Moment Police Confront Luigi Mangione At McDonald's | 10 News
description: Prosecutors have released bodycam footage showing the moment police officers first confronted Luigi Mangione, who identified himself as ‘Mark Azaria’, at a Pennsylvania McDonald's before arresting him.  The footage, taken five days after UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson was gunned down on a New York City sidewalk, shows Mangione inside the fast-food restaurant in Altoona, where officers approached him and asked for his name.  It’s understood after the 27-year-old was handcuffed, a police officer found a loaded gun magazine wrapped in a pair of underwear in Mangione’s backpack.  Mangione has pleaded not guilty to both state and federal murder charges, which carry the possibility of the death penalty.
